business.headline: RBI MPC decision today: Will there be a surprise rate cut?India has seen supportive fiscal measures this year, including changes in income tax slabs and GST cuts, which are expected to boost consumption during the festive season.

Government keeps PPF, NSC and other small savings rates unchanged. Check hereThe government has kept interest rates unchanged for key small savings schemes, including PPF and NSC, for the upcoming quarter.

LG Electronics India's Rs 15,000 crore IPO to open on October 7. Check detailsThe much-anticipated IPO of LG Electronics India, worth Rs 15,000 crore, is scheduled to open on October 7. Here's everything you need to know.

Behind the buffet: How restaurants profit from all-you-can-eat deals'All you can eat.' That is how buffets work. But then how do famous buffets such as BBQ Nation, The GT Road, and Pirates of Grill, with prices ranging from Rs 900-1400, make a profit serving unlimited food?

Gold and silver lead the way as investors seek stability, says expertWith stock market volatility unsettling investors, many are turning to gold and silver for safety. Experts say the renewed interest in precious metals reflects a broader search for stability amid uncertain conditions.
Sensex, Nifty fall for 8th day in a row ahead of RBI MPC decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 97.32 points to close at 80,267.62, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 23.80 points to end at 24,611.10.

Why staying consistent matters more than timing the market, says expertWhile market swings grab attention, experts insist that consistent investing, rather than trying to predict peaks and dips, is what helps investors achieve reliable growth over time.

Is Zoho made in India? Founder Sridhar Vembu answersSridhar Vembu, founder and former CEO of Zoho Corporation, has addressed concerns about where Zoho products are developed, where user data is stored, and the pricing of its messaging service, Arattai.

5 reasons why gold hit a record high today. Should you buy?Today, gold touched a historic high, fuelled by global uncertainty and market trends. We break down five key factors behind the rise, and whether it's a smart buy.

TCS shares slide as uncertainty grows over job cuts, staff report fluidity listTCS stock has fallen 4.65% in the past five days and 6.72% in the past month. Over the past year, it has lost nearly a third of its value, with reports of large-scale layoffs creating fresh panic among employees.

Will Post Office Savings Schemes like PPF and NSC witness a rate cut?With the Finance Ministry set to review small savings rates at the end of September, many investors are wondering if schemes like PPF and NSC will see a cut. The RBI's recent repo rate reductions have only added to the speculation.

Where to invest in PSU banks and NBFCs? Analysts pick top stocksPSU banks remain one of the most attractive options in the current market. With the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) scheduled to meet soon, market watchers are keeping a close eye on any rate-related decisions

New RBI proposals to make borrowing easier, tighten credit checksAnnounced through seven directions and circulars on September 29, 2025, three of these changes will take effect from October 1, while four others have been released for public consultation until October 20, 2025.
Sensex jumps 250 points, Nifty above 24,500; BEL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 299.85 points to 80,664.79, while the NSE Nifty50 added 71 points to 24,705.90 as of 9:24 am.

Tata Capital vs WeWork India: Which IPO should you invest in?Two names drawing strong attention this week are Tata Capital Ltd and WeWork India Management Ltd, both preparing to make their market debuts in October 2025.

RBI simplifies process for claim settlement of deceased account holdersThe new framework by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has been introduced to remove the confusion caused by different practices followed by banks earlier.

When will the 8th Pay Commission be implemented? Here's what you should knowThe Pay Commission affects much more than basic salaries. It influences allowances, pensions, and long-term financial security. In times of rising inflation, employees and pensioners are especially keen for the Commission's work to begin.

From CEOs to ministers, support pours in for Zoho's ArattaiThe rise of Arattai has caught the attention of users, industry leaders, and public figures, many of whom have shared their support and congratulations for Zoho and its founder, Sridhar Vembu.

Who should invest in Tata Capital IPO? Market expert weighs inThe Tata Capital IPO is around the corner, and many investors are wondering whether it's the right bet. A market expert has broken down who should consider subscribing and who may want to stay cautious.

Sensex, Nifty close flat as investors turn cautious over US-India trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 61.52 points lower to end at 80,364.94, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.80 points to close at 24,634.90.

Moody's keeps India's Baa3 rating unchanged with stable outlookMoody's said India's strengths include its large and fast-growing economy, a sound external position, and a stable domestic financing base for fiscal deficits.

Beyond metros: How festive cheer boosts real estate demand in Tier-2 citiesWhile metros grab most of the headlines, smaller cities are quietly stealing the show. With festivals around the corner, Tier-2 cities are witnessing a strong spike in property interest and sales.

Lufthansa layoffs: German airline plans 4,000 job cuts over next 5 yearsThe job cuts will mainly affect administrative roles rather than operational positions such as pilots, cabin crew or ground staff.

Does EPFO's new ECR system simplify return filing for employers?The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has launched a revamped electronic challan-cum-return (ECR) system, aiming to make return filing easier and more accurate for employers. But does it really simplify the process?

Will RBI announce a rate cut in the upcoming MPC meeting? Here's what to expectThe Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee begins its three-day meeting to decide whether it is time to cut interest rates or hold steady. With inflation easing and growth signals mixed, all eyes are on what the central bank does next.
Experts reveal best festive stocks to buy amid global uncertaintyConcerns over global trade talks with the US and new protectionist measures have weighed on investor sentiment
Sensex opens 142 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; BEL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 114.15 points to 80,540.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,691.15 as of 9:24 am.

Arattai success proves why Zoho won't rush going public, says Sridhar VembuIn a post on X, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu said that some of Zoho's key projects, such as its messaging app Arattai, would have never been built under the financial pressures faced by public companies.

LIC sees Rs 1,100 crore inflows on Day 1 of GST-free life cover: ReportLife Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) collected over Rs 1,100 crore in inflows on the first day following the removal of GST on individual life insurance policies.
Insured, but where is the protection?Despite the recent reform of zero GST, insurance remains an opaque industry where customers struggle to understand what they're actually buying.

Buying home this festive season? Top things to check before Griha PraveshaFamilies often see this period as the most auspicious time to make a big investment like a home, but experts warn that it is also the stage when due diligence becomes most important.

Nirav Modi's brother-in-law Maiank Mehta pardoned in Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam caseA special CBI court granted pardon to Maiank Mehta, brother-in-law of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case.

What to expect from the National Stock Exchange in the next 5 years?Ashish Chauhan, CEO of NSE Chauhan, said the rise in investors and market size over the last decade gives a clear idea of the potential ahead. In 2014, India had just 1.67 crore unique investors. Today, there are about 12 crore investors.

50% tariffs and growth: Why India must focus on reform, not retaliationAt the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts called for reforms, investment-led growth, and targeted support for vulnerable sectors to navigate challenges from steep US tariffs.

Explained: Why Dalal Street has an edge over global stock marketsAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, Ashish Chauhan, CEO of the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE), explained why India's markets and economy hold a stronger position for the future compared to others.

From 50% tariffs to growth: Why India needs reforms, not retaliationAs the US slaps steep tariffs on Indian goods, the debate is shifting from retaliation to reform. Experts at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 say India should use this moment to push for deeper reforms that fuel investment and boost domestic demand.
How to invest in pharma and IT stocks during current slowdownWith the US announcing fresh tariffs on branded drugs and uncertainty around H-1B visa rules, both sectors are experiencing headwinds.

India-US trade talks advance amid tariff and energy discussionsIndia-US trade discussions are gaining momentum, with both nations exploring ways to enhance economic cooperation, address tariffs, and boost energy trade.

Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

entertainment.headline: Mammootty arrives in Hyderabad for Patriot shoot, meets Anurag Kashyap Actor Mammootty arrived in Hyderabad for the new filming schedule of 'Patriot' amid health speculation. He was welcomed by filmmaker Anurag Kashyap at the hotel.

Madonna says embracing spirituality helped her deal with sepsis Madonna revealed details of her 2023 hospitalisation due to sepsis and how Kabbalah helped her recovery. Her experience highlights the role of spirituality and acceptance in overcoming serious illness.

Deepika Padukone claims top spot in new IMDb list, talks of challenging status quo Deepika Padukone ranked top among female actors in IMDb's 25-year Indian cinema report. She emphasised challenging norms and hopes to inspire future actors.

AI 'actress' Tilly Norwood denounced by Hollywood's SAG-AFTRA SAG-AFTRA, or the Screen Actors Guild and the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists, has denounced Tilly Norwood, the AI-generated 'actress' created by Eline Van der Velden

Shah Rukh Khan named India's most prolific star by IMDb IMDb report highlights Shah Rukh Khan's prominence in Indian cinema over 25 years. Shift in stardom dynamics with more actors sharing the spotlight in recent years.

AR Rahman on music legacy, AI, virtual groups, KPop Demon Hunters AR Rahman is pioneering a virtual musical universe called Secret Mountain with global collaborators. This project aims to unite cultures through AI-driven music while preserving human creativity.

Tom Holland clarifies relationship status with Zendaya Actor Tom Holland corrected a journalist who called Zendaya his girlfriend during a panel. Their engagement has been carefully planned, but wedding preparations are yet to begin.

John Mayer to make Mumbai debut next year, calls India a long-time dream Singer John Mayer to perform live in Mumbai for the first time in January next year. The event at Mahalaxmi Racecourse is produced and promoted by BookMyShow Live.

Confidence Queen review: A stylish heist drama that balances wit and suspenseRelease Date:Sat Sep 06, 2025 Confidence Queen is a stylish K-drama that blends heist thrills with deep emotional storytelling. The show's clever scams and strong characters keep viewers hooked despite minor plot distractions.

Lahore 1947: Sunny Deol resumes shoot after Aamir Khan suggests changes Actor Sunny Deol returned to shoot the final schedule of 'Lahore 1947' in Punjab following Aamir Khan's creative input. The film's release has been postponed to 2026 to ensure superior quality and vision.

Tere Ishk Mein: What to expect from Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's film Filmmaker Aanand L Rai and Dhanush reunite for the romantic drama 'Tere Ishk Mein'. The teaser hints at a passionate love story with soulful music and new character dynamics.

Actor Mandana Karimi hospitalised: My last heartbeat turned out to be exhaustion Actor Mandana Karimi was hospitalised after fearing she had felt her last heartbeat. Extensive tests later confirmed her condition was caused by extreme exhaustion, dehydration, and stress rather than a heart problem.

Avika Gor marries long-time boyfriend Milind Chandwani on Pati, Patni Aur Panga Actor Avika Gor and her long-time boyfriend Milind Chandwani are now married. Their wedding took place on the sets of 'Pati Patni Aur Panga.'

Kantara Chapter 1: Here's what Rishab Shetty charged for the film Ahead of 'Kantara: Chapter 1', the details of actor-director Rishab Shetty's paycheque are out. The film is reportedly made on a budget of Rs 125 crore and is set to release in cinemas on October 2, 2025.

Varun Dhawan or Kriti Sanon? Thamma writer Niren Bhatt hints at werewolf cameo Writer Niren Bhatt teased a surprise regarding the identity of the werewolf in the upcoming horror-comedy 'Thamma'. The Maddock Horror Comedy Universe nears a major character crossover by introducing a larger, more powerful werewolf and unresolved questions for viewers.

Anurag Kashyap: Was feeling isolated, my peers didn't want to be seen with me Anurag Kashyap opens up about his frustration with clickbait culture and negativity in the film industry. He reveals how this disillusionment has led him to step away from cinema and focus on what he truly loves.

Param: Punjab's 'That Girl' who's changing the game with raw musical talent Paramjeet Kaur, a 19-year-old from Punjab, is making waves as the first authentic female rapper in Punjabi hip-hop. Her viral debut track challenges industry norms and inspires many across India.

Single Salma trailer: Huma stuck in quirky love triangle with Shreyas, Sunny Singh The trailer of Huma Qureshi's upcoming film 'Single Salma' is finally out. The movie also stars Shreyas Talpade and Sunny Singh in key roles.

BTS' Jungkook parties with SEVENTEEN's Mingyu for CXM unit debut BTS' Jungkook attended SEVENTEEN Mingyu and S Coups' listening party for CXM's debut mini-album. Multiple K-pop stars, including members of the '97-liners' group, gathered to support the new unit.

general news.headline: US faces government shutdown after Senate vote fails, Trump threatens layoffsThe US faces a looming government shutdown as Democrats and Republicans clash over health care and spending. With a midnight deadline, both sides trade blame, leaving hundreds of thousands of federal workers at risk.

Trump lost bigger picture by targeting India over Russian oil: Ex-NSA John BoltonFormer US NSA John Bolton blasted Donald Trump for sanctioning India over Russian oil, accusing him of losing strategic focus, sparing Russia and China, and undermining US-India ties amid escalating trade tensions.

Zubeen Garg's manager, fest organiser arrested in death case; on way to GuwahatiNEIF organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta was detained in Singapore and first brought to Delhi before being flown to Guwahati. Zubeen Garg's aide Siddharth Sharma was detained in Gurugram.

Collect Asia Cup trophy in person: PCB chief's directive to Suryakyumar YadavPakistan Cricket Board chief and Asian Cricket Council head Mohsin Naqvi has refused to give the Asia Cup trophy to India. He has directed Indian captain Suryakuar Yadav to collect it in person from the ACC office.

RSS at 100: A century of sewa, sangathan and sacrificeThe RSS centenary is a testament to sacrifice, devotion, and resilience. Despite hardships and bans, swayamsevaks, families, and saints kept the mission alive. Rooted in public support, the Sangh's work now seeks deeper societal participation for nation-building.

RBI MPC decision today: Will there be a surprise rate cut?India has seen supportive fiscal measures this year, including changes in income tax slabs and GST cuts, which are expected to boost consumption during the festive season.

What would you have done if you were PM during Pahalgam attack? Owaisi repliesAsaduddin Owaisi refuses to entertain a question about his actions as a hypothetical Prime Minister during the Pahalgam terror attack, saying he concentrates on reality and his current political responsibilities instead of speculation.

Trump reposts Modi's support for Gaza peace plan without adding his own wordsDonald Trump reshared PM Modi's endorsement of his Gaza peace plan, which Modi called a "viable pathway" to lasting peace and security, urging all parties to unite behind Trump's initiative.

IND vs SL: Amanjot, Deepti's all-round rescue act gets India off to winning startAmanjot Kaur and Deepti Sharma delivered heroic all-round performances to help India win their Women's World Cup opener against Sri Lanka.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

Massive 6.9 magnitude quake jolts Philippines, deaths rise to 31, over 140 injuredPhilippine seismology agency Phivolcs had warned of aftershocks and damage from the offshore tremor. It also warned that strong currents and rapid changes of seawater level are expected.

You saved millions: Asim Munir praised my India-Pak ceasefire, says TrumpDonald Trump said that Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir told him he saved millions of lives during the India-Pakistan conflict, calling the acknowledgement "beautiful".

Behind the buffet: How restaurants profit from all-you-can-eat deals'All you can eat.' That is how buffets work. But then how do famous buffets such as BBQ Nation, The GT Road, and Pirates of Grill, with prices ranging from Rs 900-1400, make a profit serving unlimited food?

Trump calls 'tariff' his most beautiful word, says it's making America richUS President Donald Trump on Tuesday said that his favourite word in the English dictionary is "tariff," calling it the "most beautiful" word and crediting it for making the United States "rich."

Delhi molester baba's chats reveal sex demands, 'Dubai Sheikh' trafficking angleSwami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, the former head of a management institute in Vasant Kunj, was arrested in Agra last week after more than 15 women students accused him of molestation, blackmail and intimidation.

Pete Hegseth declares war on 'fat generals': Resign if you don't support the agendaPete Hegseth called the appearance of overweight troops "completely unacceptable" and announced that all fitness tests should align solely with male benchmarks.

How Navratri fasts affect blood sugar in diabeticsDuring fasting, long gaps between meals can disrupt the delicate balance of blood sugar. Dr Vimal Pahuja, MD, Associate Director, Internal Medicine & Metabolic Physician, Diabetes & Weight Management Clinic, Dr L.H. Hiranandani Hospital, Powai, Mumbai, explains how to fast safely.

PCOS vs PCOD: It's not a disease, it's a syndrome says expertsPCOS and PCOD are often used interchangeably, but they are not the same. Experts explain how they differ, their symptoms, and which condition may require more medical attention.

How 'miracle cures' claims were used for mass conversion to Christianity in UPLucknow's Nigoha is at the centre of a conversion storm after police unearthed what they say was a well-oiled nexus luring Dalits into Christianity under the guise of miracle healing.

Trump gives Hamas '3 or 4 days' to accept Gaza peace plan, warns of 'sad end'Trump said Hamas has "three or four days" to respond to the Gaza peace proposal. He warned that it would be a "very sad end" if Hamas rejected the deal.

Woman dressed as nun performs dandiya in Bhopal, Internet reacts to viral videoA video of a woman dressed as a nun performing dandiya in Bhopal has gone viral. It has prompted mixed reactions from social media users.

Nine dead, several injured as arch collapses at Chennai's thermal power stationNine workers died and ten others were injured after an arch collapsed at North Chennai Thermal Power Station construction site. Injured workers were rushed to Stanley Hospital. Rescue and investigation are ongoing.

Barron Trump's date night: Trump Tower floor shut down, Secret Service presentBarron Trump reportedly shut down an entire Trump Tower floor for a date, highlighting the unusual mix of privilege and security shaping his teenage life, from Xbox chats to a USD 150M net worth.

Pakistan's top leadership to decide on deployment of troops in Gaza: Ishaq DarPakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar said the country's leadership will decide on sending troops to Gaza as part of a Muslim nations' peacekeeping force, after talks with President Trump at the UN.

Mammootty arrives in Hyderabad for Patriot shoot, meets Anurag KashyapActor Mammootty arrived in Hyderabad for the new filming schedule of 'Patriot' amid health speculation. He was welcomed by filmmaker Anurag Kashyap at the hotel.

sports.headline: After Asia Cup debacle, Pakistan Cricket Board suspends NOCs for T20 leagues After their debacle in the Asia Cup 2025, Pakistan Cricket Board has refused to provide No Objection Certificates to Pakistani players who wish to play in overseas T20 leagues. The move comes after Pakistan lost thrice to India in a space of 15 days.

Collect Asia Cup trophy in person: PCB chief's directive to Suryakyumar Yadav Pakistan Cricket Board chief and Asian Cricket Council head Mohsin Naqvi has refused to give the Asia Cup trophy to India. He has directed Indian captain Suryakuar Yadav to collect it in person from the ACC office.

IND vs SL: Harmanpreet Kaur doffs hat to Deepti, Amanjot after opener win India captain Harmanpreet Kaur heaped praise on Deepti Sharma and Amanjot Kaur after their all-round efforts helped the hosts secure a 59-run win over Sri Lanka in the opening match of the Women's World Cup 2025.

West Indies avoid whitewash as Nepal go on to claim historic 2-1 series win Nepal lost the final T20 match against West Indies despite leading the series 2-0. The defeat highlights challenges ahead as Nepal prepares for the 2026 World Cup qualifiers.

World Cup ready: Tahlia McGrath says Australia's squad spoilt for choice Australia's Tahlia McGrath believes that the Australian women's squad is spoilt for choice as they eye a win against New Zealand to kickstart their World Cup title defence.

In World Cups, stats don't matter: Tahlia McGrath on Australia vs New Zealand opener Australia's Tahlia McGrath is focused on the upcoming ODI World Cup opener against New Zealand in Indore. She stresses the importance of preparation and adaptability over past records in this high-pressure tournament.

IND vs SL: Amanjot, Deepti's all-round rescue act gets India off to winning start Amanjot Kaur and Deepti Sharma delivered heroic all-round performances to help India win their Women's World Cup opener against Sri Lanka.

New Zealand skipper Sophie Devine eager for clash against big sister Australia New Zealand skipper Sophie Devine said her side is eager for their clash against defending champions Australia. Devine said she is unfazed about New Zealand's poor record against the Aussies and is aiming for a big impact in their opener.

Kuldeep's blood boils the moment he sees Pakistan, reveals childhood coach Kuldeep Yadav shone with four wickets against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2025 final. His childhood coach credits fierce rivalry and discipline for his outstanding performance.

Haven't retired yet: NZ skipper Sophie Devine's cheeky remark on retirement question New Zealand skipper Sophie Devine reminded a reporter that she is yet to retire from the game fully. Devine will retire from ODIs at the end of the ongoing tournament but will continue to play T20Is for the White Ferns.

Afghanistan's refugee women's cricket team attends World Cup opener in Guwahati Afghanistan's refugee women's cricket team attended the Women's World Cup 2025 opening fixture between India and Sri Lanka in Guwahati. A group of Afghanistan's women's cricketers are currently living in exile, having fled their country to escape the Taliban government.

India begin prep for West Indies: Bumrah, Kuldeep, Axar restedIndia started their Test series preparations against West Indies shortly after their Asia Cup triumph. The team focused on managing player workload amid a tight schedule and pitch assessments.

World Para Athletics C'ships: Sumit Antil misses world record by a whisker, wins goldSumit Antil missed out on breaking his own world record by a whisker but won gold with a 71.37 m throw in Delhi at the World Para Athletics Championships on Tuesday, September 30.

How Duleep trophy helped Kuldeep find rhythm for Asia Cup? Spinners revealsKuleep Yadav revealed how bowling in the Duleep trophy helped him to get back into the groove for the Asia Cup, where he emerged as one of India's star players. Kuldeep ended the tournament as the leading wicket-taker in the tournament.

BCCI grills PCB chief Naqvi over Asia Cup trophy fiasco, to complain to ICCThe BCCI on Tuesday, September 30, grilled PCB chief and ACC chairman Mohsin Naqvi for his role in the Asia Cup trophy fiasco after the final between India and Pakistan.

Carlos Alcaraz continues winning spree, thumps Taylor Fritz to win Japan OpenWorld No. 1 Carlos Alcaraz defeated Taylor Fritz to win the Japan Open final. The victory marked his eighth title of the year despite a foot injury scare.

Wired for greatness: How Tilak Varma, an electrician's son, became Asia Cup hero22-year-old Tilak Varma turned out to be the hero for India in the Asia Cup Final. From modest beginnings to cricketing greatness, here is the story of a youngster who was never supposed to play cricket in the first place.

Five-star Devendran: India U-19's young gun rattles Australia in Youth TestDeepesh Devendran's brilliant bowling helped India gain the upper hand in the Youth Test against Australia. His five-wicket haul set the tone for a strong Indian performance with the ball.

BCCI grills PCB chief Naqvi over Asia Cup trophy fiasco, to complain to ICCThe BCCI on Tuesday, September 30, grilled PCB chief and ACC chairman Mohsin Naqvi for his role in the Asia Cup trophy fiasco after the final between India and Pakistan.

Dinesh Karthik set for ILT20 debut, joins Sharjah Warriorz for fourth seasonFormer India wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik will make his ILT20 debut with Sharjah Warriorz. Karthik replaces Sri Lanka's Kusal Mendis in the JP Duminy-coached Sharjah side.

Pant's cheeky retirement wish for Woakes: Definitely left a mark on meRishabh Pant sent a cheeky message to Chris Woakes after the England pacer announced his retirement from all formats of the game on September 29. Woakes played a total of 217 international games for England.

No rest for Gambhir: Coach arrives early in Ahmedabad for India vs West Indies TestIndia vs West Indies: No rest for coach Gautam Gambhir. Two days after the Asia Cup final, the head coach was in Ahmedabad. Spinner Kuldeep Yadav also travelled with the coach. The first Test of the two-match series will get underway on Thursday, October 2 at the Narendra Modi Stadium.

Tilak Varma echoes Suryakumar: India vs Pakistan rivalry no longer worth the hypeAsia Cup 2025: Tilak Varma addressed the press upon his arrival in Hyderabad on Tuesday. From playing down the buzzword Operation Tilak to echoing Suryakumar Yadav's hot take on the India vs Pakistan rivalry, the young batter fielded a variety of questions. Tilak hit a match-winning 69 in the final against Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday.

Tilak Varma refuses to call India's Asia Cup win over Pakistan Operation TilakSpeaking to the press in Hyderabad on Tuesday, Tilak Varma said he was thrilled to have made the country proud with his match-winning knock against Pakistan in the Asia Cup final. The 22-year-old struck an unbeaten 69 to guide India to a successful chase of 147 in Dubai on Sunday.

IND vs SL Highlights: Deepti Sharma, Sneh Rana star in India's 59-run winWomen's Cricket World Cup Highlights: India secured a comprehensive 59-run win over Sri Lanka to kickstart their World Cup campaign on a positive with Deepti Sharma and Sneh Rana playing key roles in the tournament-opener.

Women's World Cup: IND vs SL livestreaming details, pitch and weather reportThe 2025 ICC Women's ODI World Cup kicks off on September 30, with India facing Sri Lanka in Guwahati. Here's everything you need to know about the fixture.

RCB for sale? Lalit Modi fuels speculation, predicts record valuationLalit Modi's social media post, along with ongoing reports, suggests that Royal Challengers Bengaluru, fresh from their maiden IPL title, may soon change ownership, as Diageo explores a sale that could establish new valuation benchmarks for the league.

Pakistan punish Saim Ayub, all rounder loses place in Test squadPakistan have pusnished Saim Ayub for his horrid run in the Asia Cup. The young all-rounder has been left out of the team's Test squad vs South Africa.

Watch: West Indies great inspires Nepal captain with touching words after T20I upsetFormer West Indies pacer Ian Bishop came up with a heartwarming gesture after Nepal's historic T20I win, pausing during the presentation to praise captain Rohit Paudel.  Nepal outclassed West Indies by 90 runs on Monday in Sharjah to win a T20I series against the former world champions.

Mohun Bagan withdraw from ACL 2 as foreign players refuse to travel to IranIndian football giant Mohun Bagan has withdrawn from the AFC Champions League 2 after six foreign players refused to travel to Iran due to safety concerns. The club has approached the Court of Arbitration for Sport seeking a fair resolution amid potential sanctions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
